data.title: When Lord of the Rings Return of the King game came out, did you play it before the movie?
data.meta_description: This was something I thought about recently. The game came out before the movie, and obviously an extremely anticipated one at the time. I personally never...
data.text:
jukeboxhero2396

Dec 25, 2018

3,194

Sep 19, 2021

#1

This was something I thought about recently. The game came out before the movie, and obviously an extremely anticipated one at the time. I personally never played movie games watching before the movie.

Alric

Oct 27, 2017

2,022

Sep 19, 2021

#2

I did, same with the Star Wars Prequels.

Sep 20, 2021

#3

Yes. Yes I did.

"Fight for me, and I will release you from this living death!" - Aragorn as he performs his insta-kill move on some ghosts

Strafer

The Flagpole is Wider

Oct 25, 2017

29,867

Sweden

Sep 20, 2021

#4

I wanted to. I remember that game being dope as fuck.

Keio

978

Sep 20, 2021

#5

I think LotR was an easier case for games spoiling films, since the books had been out for about 70 years anyway. I reviewed the game and the only thing I regretted was seeing some of the cool visual ideas Peter Jackson's team came up with on a small tv first.

Prophet of Truth

10,713

Sep 20, 2021

#6

I don't remember if I played this one before the movies, but I played Lego Star Wars before Revenge of the Sith and saw how Padme died in Lego form.

Sep 20, 2021

#7

I did. As this was before the Extended Editions were a thing the Two Tower and Return of the King had scenes that were not seen in the movies yet. So I thought it was pretty cool.

Yep. Walked half an hour to the store and back on foot because my parents were busy on the day it came out (can't remember if it was a weekend or just school holidays). Saves my money for a while to get it.

#14

My favorite coop game of all time and the best 3d representation of golden axe made.

Being able to block at all times even in middle of combo was such an amazing addition.

I would kill for a spirital sequel which leaned into the conan the barbarian universe artisticly.

Kinketsu

Nov 17, 2017

2,040

Sep 20, 2021

#15

I definitely did because I didnt care much for Lord of the Rings. Two of my friends were really into it and forced me to see the first one at a late night preview but by the time the third one came around, one of them had already seen it because he was a mega fan and the other had actually passed away so I dont think I saw the movie for ages but I rented the game sharpish because I quite enjoyed Two Towers.

#21

It's pretty interesting to see that quite a few people did. I remember when the Toy Story 3 game came out I got it after watching the movie. Must have been insane to see scenes of the new movie month and a half before the film was out.

Atom

Jul 25, 2021

12,783

Sep 20, 2021

#22

This and two towers are just both really fun couch coop games. Played both of them with a friend a few years back without having any nostalgia for the original release and had a blast. So I guess technically I played it after.

Also the Hobbit video game that more closely followed the book was a really good action adventure title that I wish could get a GOG release.

Same. Also the beginning of the Helm's Deep level and the Rohan soldiers would cheer afterward.

Still the best lord of the rings video games.

I just bought two towers and return of the king for 10$ at a pawn shop for ps2. Heard they're good games and will get to them eventually.

#34

Two Towers and RotK are film based games that are held in the same regard as Goldeneye, as far as I'm concerned.

Still the best lord of the rings video games.

Owned both and holy fuck they were amazing. Specially RotK. We were playing coop like every day.

If they ever remake them, i will buy them day one.

jonasvutt

Jan 17, 2018

557

Sep 20, 2021

#35

I don't remember if I played this one before the movies, but I played Lego Star Wars before Revenge of the Sith and saw how Padme died in Lego form.

Yup, I played Lego Star Wars AND the movie adaptation before ROTS. And if I remember correctly, I also read the Dark Horse comic book adaptation before the movie, that was basically a story board for the entire movie, scene by scene.

ROTK and Two Towers are amazing games, specially Return of the King, really fun in co-op.

The GBA games were really good too, but different in style. They were more Diablo-like.

Sep 20, 2021

#36

The Two Towers/RotK/Third Age/etc. games all look really awesome from what I've seen from LPs/streams. I wish I had picked them up way back when.

Unfortunately it's extremely unlikely any of them will ever get ports or remasters since they're all EA games and they lost the LotR license a long time ago.

No. That was my college phase where I was really not into video games at all. I'm a huge LOTR fan, but I missed that whole era of LOTR games. Really the only LOTR games I've ever played are the SNES one and the Middle Earth (Shadow of Mordor/War).

Oct 25, 2017

USA

Sep 20, 2021

#46

No. I was in high school when the LOTR movies were making their theater debuts, and they all came out right around the time my friends and I finished finals. There was a pretty cheap movie theater within a mile of our high school, so we made it tradition each year to finish finals and go catch a screening of LOTR together -- Freshmen, Sophomore, and Junior years.

I got Two Towers and Return of the King games as Christmas gifts about a week after that, not right at release.

They were fun as heck to coop with my brother (who also went to the LOTR movie screenings with my friends and I).

I don't remember, but I did play the shit out of that game. It's definitely one of the best movie tie in games.
